means: 使为难( discomfit的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The opposition leader has regularly discomfited him in parliament.
sentence.Network_cn: 反对派领导人常搞得他在国会中下不来台。

sentence.Network_en: Will wanted to do likewise, but felt too discomfited.
sentence.Network_cn: 威尔也想照着做，但觉得太难堪了。

sentence.Network_en: He was discomfited by the unexpected questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 意料不到的问题使得他十分尴尬.

entry.def: If you are discomfited by something, it causes you to feel slightly embarrassed or confused.

example.ex: He will be particularly discomfited by the minister's dismissal of his plan...
example.tran: 部长对他计划的不理会将使他特别尴尬。

example.ex: The opposition leader has regularly discomfited him in parliament.
example.tran: 反对派领导人常搞得他在国会中下不来台。

"many frustrated poets end as pipe-smoking teachers"
